meanings.definition: To rule or govern as a tyrant.
meanings.sent1: The evil king tyrannises his subjects, making unfair laws and punishing them harshly.
meanings.sent2: The dictator tyrannises the people, suppressing their freedom and enforcing strict rules.
meanings.sent3: The bully in the schoolyard tyrannises the other kids, always taking their lunch money.
meanings.sent4: Fear tyrannises the hearts of those living under the oppressive regime.
meanings.sent5: The dark cloud of tyranny tyrannises the once peaceful land.

meanings.definition: To exercise oppressive power or control over others.
meanings.sent1: The corrupt government tyrannises its citizens, ignoring their rights and freedoms.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy elite tyrannises the poor workers, exploiting them for their own gain.
meanings.sent3: The strict teacher tyrannises the students with endless homework assignments.
meanings.sent4: The relentless heat tyrannises the inhabitants of the desert, making life unbearable.
meanings.sent5: The fear of failure tyrannises the young athlete, hindering their performance.
